Reviews.Title: “Fun weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: milnnjc
Reviews.Content: After reading recent reviews I was nervous arriving at this resort. We rented a 2 bedroom condo for 2 nights over labour day weekend. I had no problems at check in, the girl was very friendly, helpful and efficient. Our condo #1603 was great. Extremely clean and spacious for our family of 5. The master had a king bed and the other room had a queen bed. Kitchen has plenty cutlery, utensils etc. An excellent resort and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed, mistake”
Reviews.Author: tllmickey
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to have a condo for 8 nights, but got there and the front desk was a young man who appeared to be on his first day and really didnt know what he was doing. We then got to the unit and it smelled HORRID. On a day that was 105 degrees, the next thing was that the air conditioning unit that was jimmy rigged into the wall in the main bedroom with ceiling tile didnt work! We went back to see if the front desk might be able to help out with perhaps a different unit as we understood that no 2 are the same as they are individually owned or something like that, but there was nothing available until the next morning as the others were not clean. Luckily we went via the Tourisim Branson to do our plans - the manager Monica went above and beyond to find us something that we were willing to stay in in town that was nice. It wasnt the condo type set up we were dreaming of - but being it was the week of the 4th of July, she did excellent and saved our vacation from disaster. I would NOT recommend this set up as it is a gamble as to what you will end up getting. So doing your plans on your own or having help via Tourism set up = do not go with Pointe Royale!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice”
Reviews.Author: Jerry B
Reviews.Content: We rented a condo for 5 days on our first night we returned to the condo to find that the toilet was stopped up.I tried to call the front desk, the operator and reservations and guest services only to receive a voicemail that no one was available. Apparently after 11 pm there is no management on call.By dialing this emergency number I reached a gentleman who was very apologetic but said that a stopped up toilet would not be dealt with after hours and that this was resort policy even though our unit only had one bathroom. I worked for 1 1/2 hours trying to clear the toilet without success . My wife is so upset I fear this has ruined our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: milspocovergirl
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay for a big family. We rented the two bedroom condo #6706 Nice and clean. Has a screened in porch, large living and dining areas, the bedrooms are pretty big w king beds. The bad things so far that we can find is that we can't completely lock the master bedroom door. Lol not good!! Overall I'd stay here again, definitely better than getting two hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “you have been warned”
Reviews.Author: Joan B
Reviews.Content: We had reserved one week sept. 2011. Arrived to find no air conditioning, t v frequently blacked out and remote control was broken and scotched taped to hold it together, carpet was filthy, underwear from former guest in closet, dirty silver wear under edge of bed,one hard brown wash rag in bathroom amd three hard faded and spotted towels,food from former guests on deck, sheets on bed totaly worn out and there were other things but I think you should get the picture. We did not stay and the manager said our money woud be returned.It's been three months. No refund,even after I called to say we hadnt received it and to make sure they had my correct address. You have been warned J B Kansas

Reviews.Title: “Love the location and Feeling of being at home!”
Reviews.Author: Loey814
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother, close friend and I stayed in building 43 unit 7. The convenience of being close to the strip, yet far enough away from all of the hustle and bustle was superb. The amount of money you can save by having a unit with a FULL kitchen is enormous. The condo had two bedrooms and two full baths. There was a balcony, washer and dryer and was very close to the pool. It was nicely furnished and very clean. We rented through our travel club - Global Destinations. Would highly recommend and will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fall Break”
Reviews.Author: Grandma1913
Reviews.Content: My son, daughter-in-law, grandson and myself stayed at the Pointe Royal Resort for five nights. The condo was very clean and modern. We had two bedrooms, two baths and three beds. It was completely furnished, with washer and dryer plus all the comforts of home. This was a gated condo. Also had indoor pool and golf courses.

Reviews.Title: “If you like noisey neighbors you'll love the condos!”
Reviews.Author: Laserchamp
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great until the third night when the bigfoot family moved in upstairs! I can stand the normal creaking of the floor. (prefer not to hear it at all) but this family stomped for hours. Not just a stomp here or there, but 3 to 5 fast stomps in a row! This went on past midnight! We will NEVER stay at Pointe Royal ever again. Thousand Hills is much nicer and there are only 2 cabins per unit, side by side. We will stay there next time we come to Branson! You'd think when you pay a little more it would weed out the rude and nasty people. I guess there is rude and nasty at every price point!

Reviews.Title: “A Pigeon Forge Gal Does Branson - Pointe Royale”
Reviews.Author: shmologna
Reviews.Content: Before I write this review, I want to remind all readers that most units in Point Royale appear to be rented out by individual owners, not one large company. What you get in one unit may not apply in another. With that being said, I enjoyed staying at Pointe Royale. Our unit was unit number 4 in building number 57 on Highland Drive. The unit was two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and located on the ground floor, and was rented through VRBO.com The unit had been remodeled with new furnishings, mattresses, paint, and kitchen counters. It was very clean. The master room had a Jacuzzi/shower combo. Both bedrooms had king-sized beds with small, flat paneled televisions. I thought the value was great. With tax, cleaning fee, and all, a four night stay in April for four people was only around 500.00. Pointe Royale is also a gated community with friendly and informative security guards, on-site dining, swimming, close proximity to attractions, and a golf course right in the community. For the most part, the area was very quiet. My complaints are minor. We had some water issues one day. My father-in-law had some trouble getting warm water. And then, that night, the water system behind the condo began to buzz. It sounded like a school bell and was very loud. We called maintenance and the issue was looked into with an hour. They were working on it the next morning and we had no more water trouble. The couch in the living room is just a hard little loveseat. The television was small and the furnishings were not arranged so that all people seated could watch the screen. And, lastly, the new mattress was somewhat hard. Both my husband and I did not sleep very well. But, considering the location, security, cleanliness, and price, I really don't feel justified in complaining. Feel free to contact me if you would like the link for the condo rental.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointed and will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Trip_in_Washington
Reviews.Content: Although check was inviting and went well we were very disappointed with our stay. After a long enjoyable day in Branson (loved the town), we went back to the condo only to find hair and a stain in the bed. It was the grosses thing that I have ever experienced with a hotel/condo. Talking with the night manager we found out there were no other rooms available for us to change and if I did not already pay online I would have changed to a hotel. The night manager was very understanding and sympathetic toward the situation and did his best with the authority he had. We decided to sleep on the fold out couch that turned out to be very uncomfortable. Although we wanted to get to Silver Dollar City first thing we decided to wait for the day manager’s call. I called at 9:30am expecting the manager but she was playing a round of golf. They must have called her because I did receive a call around 10am and said she was sorry for the issue. She said she would have house cleaning come and change the sheets. Because of the first impression of the bed we did not want to sleep in that bed and we requested another room. They said they had issues with the cleaning crew the last couple of weeks. It seemed we were more of an inconvenience for her, complete opposite of the night manager. She did comp the room for the first night and provide our family with 4 show tickets only after I told her of how much this was an inconvenience to us. Other issues we experienced in the first room are it smelled like smoke and the kitchen light worked sometimes, noisy neighbors and a loud air conditioning unit. The second room was very nicely decorated and overall clean. It also had a loud air condition unit so I would assume it was an overall problem with the condos. We also were awoken at 8am by maintenance pressure washing the condos. As they say first impression is everything, we were very disappointed in Point Royal first impressions of their room and the day manager customer service skills could use some customer relations training. Although I am sure others have had a very enjoyable experience at Point Royal ours was not. With our next trip to Branson we will make sure that we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to HVG/RCI Resort Standards”
Reviews.Author: klockin
Reviews.Content: The unit is clean, but who in their right mind builds a unit with NO SHOWER in the master bath, just a whirlpool tub. Now everyone has to share the SAME SHOWER. Not my idea of a 4-star resort. Also, it's ridiculous you have to pay $5 A NIGHT just to get internet - what a rip-off. I would NOT EVER come back here again. The indoor pool is CLOSED and the outdoor pool nearest us is CLOSED and the hot tub is CLOSED. That's hardly what we would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home and Good Value Too!”
Reviews.Author: pbjk4
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a one bedroom condo. The staff was very accomodating as we had driven 10 hours from Louisiana and arrived after the office was scheduled to close. The staff kept the office open a little longer until we arrived. Our unit was roomy enough for husband, myself and two boys ages 8 and 9. Living area has a sleeper sofa but we used air mattresses from home for the kids. There is a TV in the living area and bedroom so kids could watch one set and grown ups had the other. Full kitchen with stove and microwave and the surprise was a washer and dryer in the unit! This came in handy for washing towels, wet swimsuites and other laundry. Our unit building was next to the pool and clubhouse. The decor is a bit outdated (1980's) but the unit was very clean and well maintained. This was far better than staying in a boxy motel room on the strip! The price was a bit higher but so worth it for the convenience. The only negatives were that we paid for a condo with a view of the golf course but ours was a first level unit with a patio instead of a balcony and we were on the end so our veiw was partially obstructed by a concrete wall. Definately will request a different building next time. There were also a few small ants crawling about the floor in the living area. We reported this as we checked out and were told it would be taken care of. The location is off of the strip and the resort is huge, much larger than it seems from the road. If you want to stay near the Branson action, this is not the best location. It was fine for us as we came this trip to visit Silver Dollar City and to just relax in the condo. Will definately consider staying her again!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: wkburch
Reviews.Content: We checked into Point Royale after a horrible hotel experience. We were greeted by VERY friendly and helpful front desk staff. Our one bedroom condo was very nice. It was obviously older but very well taken care of. It is like home awya from home, very spacious and perfect for our family. We have two small girls ages 5 and 3. It is so nice that they could watch DISNEY channel or their DVD's in one room and we could watch what we wanted on the the other TV. The pool was incredible. The small pool was great for our youngest and the large pool starts at 2 ft. so our oldest could swim without her floaties. Perfect for our family. We love having the full kitchen so we could have breakfast and lunch their if we wanted to hang out at the condo and saved us some money. I was also nice to have washer and dryer so we could do our laundry and not have to bring home a ton of dirty clothes. We will definitely stay at Point Royale again!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy for families”
Reviews.Author: MSgal59
Reviews.Content: Our family of five (three teens) checked in on June 30, 2008 for five nights. After unloading, we went 'out and about' to check out Branson. Upon our early evening return, we discovered ants in our kitchen. The condo management gave us the choice of staying where we were and having the condo sprayed, or moving... we moved. For our trouble, they also offered us free tickets to one of the local shows (their choice... but we enjoyed it!). The second condo was newer and much more spacious than the first. This is a gated community with a couple of pools and a golf course, but the best part is its location. It's not right on the 'strip' (Hwy 76), but is close enough to get wherever you need quickly. The unit had a washer and dryer (terrific for longer stays) and our two daughters enjoyed the smaller pool (our condo overlooked it). We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: preciouspuppies
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 7 days in Branson during the Memorial Day Holiday. We stayed at a lovely 2 bedroom at Pointe Royale. It is wonderful as it provides privacy, yet you are minutes from the heart of Branson. 165 ( Fall Creek Road) connects you to any place that you need to be. Pointe Royale has a large outdoor pool, a zero entry kids pool, an indoor heated pool and a hottub. It also has a restaurant on site, and beautiful 18 hole golf course. The club house has a fitness room. Our Condo had WiFi. Restaurants are nearby. The Condo's have full facilities to cook and eat in the Condo or you can get it to go and bring it back with you. Enjoy a movie or Game while you have a Danna's burger or Pasta from Tony Z's. The Country Mart at 65 & 165 has anything you could need from basics to high end gourmet. Jubilee is a nice store but does not have the variety. You will also find fast food at this square & a Blockbuster. It is an example of never going onto the strip if that's not your thing. Prices vary on these condo's and I highly recommend shopping around if time allows. Some are much nicer than others. This was the 13th Condo we have stayed in at Pointe Royale. All are different, all were nice, amenities vary from Condo to Condo. All have a washer & dryer. Ask about TV's, Cable, Internet, DVD players. Some are more child friendly than others. You just can't go wrong. If stairs are a concern, ASK. It takes a lot of effort to take a suitcase up 3 flights of stairs. Have a great summer in Branson this year. Suzie

Reviews.Title: “Superlative!”
Reviews.Author: recusant
Reviews.Content: An excellent stay in a privately owned (vacant in the off season) condo. Immaculately clean, pleasant, quiet. Far better than any hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: bcbcbc
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at Pointe Royale and were completely satisfied. We booked directly through their website. Since the condos are individually owned, I would imagine some might be nicer than others, but we were perfectly satisfied with ours. We had a 2 bedroom 2 bath condo. The decor was lovely and there were lots of "homey and comfy" touches. It was a wonderful place to kick back and relax after a long day of doing the tourist thing. The front desk booked our shows and they could not have been more helpful. They helped us with restaurants, directions, anything we needed. We did not use the golf course or clubhouse but they did look very nice. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pointe Royale 3 bedroom - great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lah
Reviews.Content: We rented a 3-bedroom townhouse direct from the owner. Our unit was roomy and nicely decorated. We loved the location as it was easy to get around Branson from there and you could avoid some of the heavier traffic...though traffic at the end of September is not nearly as bad as other times of the year. We had a couple of our meals at the clubhouse restaurant....both very good. When we first arrived at the townhouse, we walked across the street and found a beautiful view of Lake Taneycomo and the Table Rock Lake Dam. I just wish we had more time to explore the grounds but we were there for a weekend and ran out of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Pointe Royale”
Reviews.Author: rapbtp
Reviews.Content: The Pointe Royale in Branson is a terrific place to stay. We stayed two nights and upgraded to a deluxe two-bedroom two-bath condo and it was superb. The condo was extremely well furnished with 3 televisions, a full kitchen and an outside enclosed patio. This particular unit was on the ground floor which I recommend. The golf course looks outstanding, but unfortunately I did not have time to play golf. All the condo buildings look a little different which adds to the charm of this place. The staff was great, and I can't imagine a better place to stay in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids!”
Reviews.Author: pjmkf
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Branson and staying at the Pointe Royale. We loved the spacious condo, as did our children. We went for a hike, walked down to Lake Taneycomo and saw all the fly-fisherman. The kids found a tree that they would climb. The pool was the best! They have two outdoor pools. One kiddie pool, zero to 1 ft. and then the big pool has a big section that is 2 1/2 feet deep, our four year old could swim around free for hours in there. The lifeguard was there as well. The pool gets busy in the afternoons but there were plenty of louges and places to sit. We rented from an owner and the condo was older, but clean and really a great way to stay on vacation. We went shopping and had most of our meals at home to save the expense of eating out all the time. We could hear the people above us, but they weren't up all night long or anything so no big deal. The grounds were really nice and we were just down the road from the pool so we walked. If you stay and are far from the pool, it is well worth the short drive to the parking lot by the pool. It was great! We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: fatlaw
Reviews.Content: Very nice place - grounds are very well manicured and lush. The 24 hour gated security is nice (the million dollar homes there aren't too bad either.) The clubhouse has the best pool - huge - and nice hot tub (adults only) and the lifeguard made it easy to relax and swim while the kids played at the other end of the pool. Always able to snag a table with an umbrella or a lounge chair. The tennis courts are lighted for night play and brand new. The condos are very clean and equipped. The best thing about Pointe Royale is you can use the back roads to get to anyplace in Branson and avoid traffic!

Reviews.Title: “spacious condo”
Reviews.Author: rsfred
Reviews.Content: returned last night from a 3-night stay at Pointe Royale- had a 2br,2bath condo- spacious- king bedroom had large bathroom with jetted tub, opened onto a small screened deck- grandaughters loved the pool area- had a restaurant in clubhouse which we didn't try- we had small eating area in kitchen plus formal dining area- 3 color TV's

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: taxbabe2001
Reviews.Content: great stay, hotel staff was so helpful, reservation manager so nice, she will help you with anything, very clean rooms, great breakfast, you will have alot of fun at this place. enjoy till you drop.

Reviews.Title: “See the new lodge -- A great new events venue”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You should see their new lodge; it's absolutely gorgeous! Plenty of space for corporate meetings and special events. Would make a beautiful place for a wedding reception. Price is very reasonable -- good value for the money. Compare to other venues in the area and I think you'll be pleasantly surprised. I attended a party there and thought it was wonderful. Check it out!

HotelInfo.Name: Pointe Royale Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 158-A Pointe Royale Dr, Branson, MO 65616
